fact_check_explanation_title: The Control of Diseases Act was not changed in April to say you can be forcibly vaccinated
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no Covid-19 vaccine yet, but this law does not say you can be forced to get the injection.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post on Ireland’s plans for exiting lockdown goes viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post says phases will start on 18 May, 8 June, 29 June, 20 July and 10 August.

fact_check_explanation_title: Official advice says handwashing is better at protecting against coronavirus than gloves
fact_check_explanation_summary: The best preventive measure is still regular hand washing.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence immigrants caused a PPE shipment to be destroyed at Dover
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Home Office says these claims are totally false.

fact_check_explanation_title: It's incorrect to say flu vaccines don't work
fact_check_explanation_summary: An argument that the flu vaccine doesn’t work because the flu has not been eliminated doesn’t add up.

fact_check_explanation_title: A doctor claims his contract was terminated after talking about PPE shortages to the press
fact_check_explanation_summary: Concern that the story was incorrect led to prominent posts on social media being deleted.

fact_check_explanation_title: It seems unlikely the accounts resharing a viral post about the UK press are bots
fact_check_explanation_summary: The viral message began on Facebook in late April.

fact_check_explanation_title: What we know, and what we don’t, about the true coronavirus death toll
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s too soon to compare the UK’s coronavirus death toll with other countries

fact_check_explanation_title: Has the government really hit 100,000 tests a day, and what happens next?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Full Fact has looked into the reality behind the government’s testing target.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some PPE exported to the EU could have been used in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: At PMQs Dominic Raab was right to point out it isn’t necessarily the case that PPE exported from the UK could have been used here. But some PPE exported to …

fact_check_explanation_title: The government hasn’t provided evidence for its claim that 15,000 arrive per day into the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims from the Health Secretary that 15,000 passengers are still arriving in the UK per day during the coronavirus lockdown haven’t been backed up.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Nobel Prize-winning immunologist has not said coronavirus is manmade, as claimed
fact_check_explanation_summary: Professor Tasuku Honjo said: “I am greatly saddened that my name and that of Kyoto University have been used to spread false accusations and misinformation”.
